A chaotic, mixed bag compilation of fanfiction, headcanons, imagines, and drabbles for BNHA.

Submissions: || Open! ||

ALL characters in NSFW posts are written as 18+. For info on shout outs, features, and removal requests please see the info link.

summary: You bet! (◍•ᴗ•◍)<3 Thank you so much for the kind words, also! I have been feeling a lot better lately, so I appreciate the...
caption:
You bet! (◍•ᴗ•◍)<3 Thank you so much for the kind words, also! I have been feeling a lot better lately, so I appreciate the positive vibes!

I match you with Tamaki Amajiki! 

☆ He first noticed you when he and Mirio crossed paths with you on the school grounds. Sunny Mirio was happy to introduce himself, and Tamaki by extension, but he couldn’t help but notice how the unprompted socialization caught you off guard. He’d always been astutely aware of his tendency to become uncomfortable in social situations, and had mostly been ridiculed for it. His interest was piqued to meet someone who not only seemed to feel the same, but just might be able to empathize. 

☆ It might be weeks before he’d devise a way to talk to you again. He didn’t want to embarrass himself, but most importantly he didn’t want to embarrass you. How could he approach someone to bond over something neither of you likely wanted to discuss? Eventually, he was able to sit down and pen something halfway decent. It felt almost childlike, to pass you a note but he was afraid he couldn’t articulate it any other way. His last mistake was sheepishly asking Mirio to proofread it - his goal from then on was to make his friend happy and introduce the two of you formally. 

☆ Mirio was, undeniably, a superb wingman but Tamaki grimaced with unease at each of his attempts to bring you two closer together. The more he got to know you though, he was relieved to find that your vibrant personality made it easier and easier to talk with you - it was hard for him to resist a small chuckle when you finally levelled with Mirio, letting him know that “if your friend wants to talk to me, surely he can do it himself”.

“Then my job here is done!” Mirio said with a smile and a wink.

☆ Tamaki appreciates your ability to give sound advice and encouragement, even if his kneejerk reaction is to feel as though he is being patronized, or scolded. In time he’d come to subdue those feelings, realizing you truly do have his best intentions at heart, he would do his best to internalize those feelings, and reciprocate as often as possible. 

☆ He’d be grateful at first that so many of your interests could be enjoyed together without much talk, or socialization. It was a sort of security blanket at first, but in time he came to truly appreciate the long, quiet evenings with you watching your favorite shows, reading books, or having you read a favorite story to him. It allowed you to share a bond that had little need for words, which he treasured. 

☆ His somewhat escapist tendencies would allow him to revel in your love of fantasy with you, from worlds filled with magic, to those more realistic tales of the triumph of good versus evil. With your artistic tendencies, he’d find ways of helping you develop new stories, and plan art pieces - often times indulging himself by imagining the two of you in place of the main characters. He’s likely suggested drawing the two of you as Hogwarts students more than once. 

As an aside, what house to you see Tamaki being sorted to?

I hope you enjoyed~!

reblog.comment:
You bet! (◍•ᴗ•◍)<3 Thank you so much for the kind words, also! I have been feeling a lot better lately, so I appreciate the positive vibes!

summary: I washified my phone case!! It's a bit (?) of a sloppy job and the pic is meh but it's really, really cute and I super love it!...
body: I washified my phone case!! It’s a bit (?) of a sloppy job and the pic is meh but it’s really, really cute and I super love it! I bought the washi tape from @munette, go check and by her stuff! I also bought some BNHA postcards and pouches, I’ll show it to you guys sometime.

blog.name: fandom-addicts-yeah
blog.title: fandoms ruined our life
blog.description:
Our Masterlist.
The Fandoms we write for!
We're a multifandom writing blog!Just send in scenario, headcanons, ships, or even small drabble requests and we will do our best at satisfying your needs. SHIPS:CLOSED. SCENARIOS, HEADCANON, DRABBLES:OPEN

summary: Hey! Could I get 2 and 43 with Kirishima? Thank you!
question: Hey! Could I get 2 and 43 with Kirishima? Thank you!
answer:
2. “Hey, hey, calm down. They can’t hurt you anymore.”

43. “I feel like I can’t breathe.”

Ahhhhh we’re back! Still alive, but school got us cramped up for the past month. I’m very sorry and I hope I can be more active on here from now on.

((also please request more Boku No Hero Academia, we all really enjoy writing for it!))

~mod Sarah

__________________________________________

Smoke was rapidly rising from the ruins of what was left of the now almost empty building that (y/n) was making their way out of. The intoxicating fumes were easily infiltrating through the thin material of the young hero in training’s costume, which they tried to pinch up over their mouth and nostrils to block the insufferable smell.

They shouldn’t have been so bold. Patrolling the streets with their mentor has become a daily routine during their internship and yet nothing could predict the tragedy that was bound to happen.

An amateur villain with a fire-based quirk was all that it took for a small apartment block to light up and for (y/n) to rush in and try to get as many people as possible out. The pro-hero that was in charge of them was preoccupied with the villain and (y/n) saw that as a chance to sneak in and get a grip of what their future career will be like.

They knew that as long as they don’t use their quirk in battle, everything should be fine and legal and, as a worst case scenario, they would probably just get nagged by their mentor. That, if everything would go alright.

They also knew that he more time they’d spend in the smoke filled building, the worse it will get for their lungs and soon enough, their breathing will cease. So, they made a mental note to be quick, took a deep breath of air and stepped right into the flaming building, with a shaky smile.

They managed to escort all of the people that were living there and yet somehow they still got left behind. One floor above the ground, they were forcing their legs to support their own weight. The nausea and tiredness of their body was restricting them from using their quirk. Smoke was grazing their eyeballs, forming tears with the help of the panic that was rising in their chest.

The flames were engulfing the room and burning the cheap wood it was made out of way too fast. Faith had it that a burnt ceiling grid fell directly over (y/n)’s leg and, with a short and faint yelp, they went down with it.

Their vision went black as only one thought raced through their head.

‘I don’t want to die. I can’t die yet’

As if on cue, a loud crash sent pieces of debris flying around the room and made (y/n) flinch as their head instantly started throbbing from the sound.

A faint, yet familiar voice echoed through their thoughts, keeping them half awake. They slowly opened their heavy eyelids and, through black and hazy dots, they recognized him. A worrisome expression etched onto his blurry face, his red hair clinging to his forehead because of the sweat he gained from the blazing flames. Him.

“Kirishima…” they mumbled, pushing themselves upwards with all of their force, but to no avail. Their body felt numb and, if you asked them, they wouldn’t be able to lift a finger. With shaky hands, the boy removed the burnt wood off of (y/n)’s leg and picked them up, covering as much of their body as he can with his hardened and fire-resistant one.

“Shh, hey, calm down. It can’t hurt you anymore.” He cooed into their ear, while breaking through the already ravished building, in search of the fastest and hopefully safest route out.

“I…I can’t breathe…” (y/n) whimpered hoarsely, coughing after every word. Their lungs burnt from the fumes even though the red-haired boy was doing everything in his power to keep their face away from the hellish atmosphere.

“I know (y/n), I know. Please stay with me. Keep your eyes opened for me, please.” Kirishima pleaded, his eyes threatening to spill salty tears over his cheeks. “We’re almost out.”

____________________________________

Drabble requests are opened!!

~mod Sarah

“I…I can’t breathe…” (y/n) whimpered hoarsely, coughing after every word. Their lungs burnt from the fumes even though the red-haired boy was doing everything in his power to keep their face away from the hellish atmosphere.

“I know (y/n), I know. Please stay with me. Keep your eyes opened for me, please.” Kirishima pleaded, his eyes threatening to spill salty tears over his cheeks. “We’re almost out.”

____________________________________

Drabble requests are opened!!

~mod Sarah
trail.content:
2. “Hey, hey, calm down. They can’t hurt you anymore.”

43. “I feel like I can’t breathe.”

Ahhhhh we’re back! Still alive, but school got us cramped up for the past month. I’m very sorry and I hope I can be more active on here from now on.

((also please request more Boku No Hero Academia, we all really enjoy writing for it!))

~mod Sarah

__________________________________________

Smoke was rapidly rising from the ruins of what was left of the now almost empty building that (y/n) was making their way out of. The intoxicating fumes were easily infiltrating through the thin material of the young hero in training’s costume, which they tried to pinch up over their mouth and nostrils to block the insufferable smell.

They shouldn’t have been so bold. Patrolling the streets with their mentor has become a daily routine during their internship and yet nothing could predict the tragedy that was bound to happen.

An amateur villain with a fire-based quirk was all that it took for a small apartment block to light up and for (y/n) to rush in and try to get as many people as possible out. The pro-hero that was in charge of them was preoccupied with the villain and (y/n) saw that as a chance to sneak in and get a grip of what their future career will be like.

They knew that as long as they don’t use their quirk in battle, everything should be fine and legal and, as a worst case scenario, they would probably just get nagged by their mentor. That, if everything would go alright.

They also knew that he more time they’d spend in the smoke filled building, the worse it will get for their lungs and soon enough, their breathing will cease. So, they made a mental note to be quick, took a deep breath of air and stepped right into the flaming building, with a shaky smile.

They managed to escort all of the people that were living there and yet somehow they still got left behind. One floor above the ground, they were forcing their legs to support their own weight. The nausea and tiredness of their body was restricting them from using their quirk. Smoke was grazing their eyeballs, forming tears with the help of the panic that was rising in their chest.

The flames were engulfing the room and burning the cheap wood it was made out of way too fast. Faith had it that a burnt ceiling grid fell directly over (y/n)’s leg and, with a short and faint yelp, they went down with it.

Their vision went black as only one thought raced through their head.

‘I don’t want to die. I can’t die yet’

As if on cue, a loud crash sent pieces of debris flying around the room and made (y/n) flinch as their head instantly started throbbing from the sound.

A faint, yet familiar voice echoed through their thoughts, keeping them half awake. They slowly opened their heavy eyelids and, through black and hazy dots, they recognized him. A worrisome expression etched onto his blurry face, his red hair clinging to his forehead because of the sweat he gained from the blazing flames. Him.

“Kirishima…” they mumbled, pushing themselves upwards with all of their force, but to no avail. Their body felt numb and, if you asked them, they wouldn’t be able to lift a finger. With shaky hands, the boy removed the burnt wood off of (y/n)’s leg and picked them up, covering as much of their body as he can with his hardened and fire-resistant one.

“Shh, hey, calm down. It can’t hurt you anymore.” He cooed into their ear, while breaking through the already ravished building, in search of the fastest and hopefully safest route out.

“I…I can’t breathe…” (y/n) whimpered hoarsely, coughing after every word. Their lungs burnt from the fumes even though the red-haired boy was doing everything in his power to keep their face away from the hellish atmosphere.

“I know (y/n), I know. Please stay with me. Keep your eyes opened for me, please.” Kirishima pleaded, his eyes threatening to spill salty tears over his cheeks. “We’re almost out.”

____________________________________

Drabble requests are opened!!

~mod Sarah
